sigma/proc_creation_win_7zip_exfil_dmp_f.description: Detects a suspicious 7zip execution that involves a file with a ".dmp"/".dump" extension, which could be a step in a process of dump file exfiltration
sigma/proc_creation_win_7zip_exfil_dmp_f.author: sigma

sigma/proc_creation_win_7zip_password_co.description: An adversary may compress or encrypt data that is collected prior to exfiltration using 3rd party utilities
sigma/proc_creation_win_7zip_password_co.author: sigma

labels.label: Compress Data and Lock With Password for Exfiltration With 7-ZIP

sigma/proc_creation_win_7zip_password_ex.description: Detects usage of 7zip utilities (7z.exe, 7za.exe and 7zr.exe) to extract password protected zip files.
sigma/proc_creation_win_7zip_password_ex.author: sigma

labels.label: Password Protected Compressed File Extraction Via 7Zip

sigma/proc_creation_win_adplus_memory_du.description: Detects execution of "AdPlus.exe", a binary that is part of the Windows SDK that can be used as a LOLBIN in order to dump process memory and execute arbitrary commands.
sigma/proc_creation_win_adplus_memory_du.author: sigma

sigma/proc_creation_win_at_interactive_e.description: Detects an interactive AT job, which may be used as a form of privilege escalation.
sigma/proc_creation_win_at_interactive_e.author: sigma

sigma/proc_creation_win_attrib_hiding_fi.description: Detects usage of attrib.exe to hide files from users.
sigma/proc_creation_win_attrib_hiding_fi.author: sigma

sigma/proc_creation_win_attrib_system.description: Detects the execution of "attrib" with the "+s" flag to mark files as system files
sigma/proc_creation_win_attrib_system.author: sigma

labels.label: Set Files as System Files Using Attrib.EXE

sigma/proc_creation_win_attrib_system_su.description: Detects the usage of attrib with the "+s" option to set scripts or executables located in suspicious locations as system files to hide them from users and make them unable to be deleted with simple rights. The rule limits the search to specific extensions and directories to avoid FPs
sigma/proc_creation_win_attrib_system_su.author: sigma

labels.label: Set Suspicious Files as System Files Using Attrib.EXE

sigma/proc_creation_win_auditpol_nt_reso.description:
Threat actors can use an older version of the auditpol binary available inside the NT resource kit to change audit policy configuration to impair detection capability.
This can be carried out by selectively disabling/removing certain audit policies as well as restoring a custom policy owned by the threat actor.
sigma/proc_creation_win_auditpol_nt_reso.author: sigma

labels.label: Audit Policy Tampering Via NT Resource Kit Auditpol

sigma/proc_creation_win_auditpol_susp_ex.description:
Threat actors can use auditpol binary to change audit policy configuration to impair detection capability.
This can be carried out by selectively disabling/removing certain audit policies as well as restoring a custom policy owned by the threat actor.
sigma/proc_creation_win_auditpol_susp_ex.author: sigma

sigma/proc_creation_win_bcdedit_boot_con.description: Detects the use of the bcdedit command to tamper with the boot configuration data. This technique is often times used by malware or attackers as a destructive way before launching ransomware.
sigma/proc_creation_win_bcdedit_boot_con.author: sigma

sigma/proc_creation_win_bcdedit_susp_exe.description: Detects potential malicious and unauthorized usage of bcdedit.exe
sigma/proc_creation_win_bcdedit_susp_exe.author: sigma

labels.label: Potential Ransomware or Unauthorized MBR Tampering Via Bcdedit.EXE

sigma/proc_creation_win_bitsadmin_downlo.description: Detects usage of bitsadmin downloading a file
sigma/proc_creation_win_bitsadmin_downlo.author: sigma

sigma/proc_creation_win_bitsadmin_downlo.description: Detects usage of bitsadmin downloading a file using an URL that contains an IP
sigma/proc_creation_win_bitsadmin_downlo.author: sigma

labels.label: Suspicious Download From Direct IP Via Bitsadmin

sigma/proc_creation_win_bitsadmin_downlo.description: Detects usage of bitsadmin downloading a file from a suspicious domain
sigma/proc_creation_win_bitsadmin_downlo.author: sigma

labels.label: Suspicious Download From File-Sharing Website Via Bitsadmin

sigma/proc_creation_win_bitsadmin_downlo.description: Detects usage of bitsadmin downloading a file with a suspicious extension
sigma/proc_creation_win_bitsadmin_downlo.author: sigma

labels.label: File With Suspicious Extension Downloaded Via Bitsadmin

sigma/proc_creation_win_bitsadmin_downlo.description: Detects usage of bitsadmin downloading a file to a suspicious target folder
sigma/proc_creation_win_bitsadmin_downlo.author: sigma

labels.label: File Download Via Bitsadmin To A Suspicious Target Folder

sigma/proc_creation_win_bitsadmin_downlo.description: Detects usage of bitsadmin downloading a file to uncommon target folder
sigma/proc_creation_win_bitsadmin_downlo.author: sigma

labels.label: File Download Via Bitsadmin To An Uncommon Target Folder

sigma/proc_creation_win_bitsadmin_potent.description: BITS will allow you to schedule a command to execute after a successful download to notify you that the job is finished. When the job runs on the system the command specified in the BITS job will be executed. This can be abused by actors to create a backdoor within the system and for persistence. It will be chained in a BITS job to schedule the download of malware/additional binaries and execute the program after being downloaded
sigma/proc_creation_win_bitsadmin_potent.author: sigma

sigma/proc_creation_win_browsers_chromiu.description: Detects chromium based browsers starting in headless and debugging mode and pointing to a user profile. This could be a sign of data stealing or remote control
sigma/proc_creation_win_browsers_chromiu.author: sigma

labels.label: Potential Data Stealing Via Chromium Headless Debugging

sigma/proc_creation_win_browsers_chromiu.description: Detects execution of chromium based browser in headless mode using the "dump-dom" command line to download files
sigma/proc_creation_win_browsers_chromiu.author: sigma

sigma/proc_creation_win_browsers_chromiu.description: Detects a suspicious process spawning a Chromium based browser process with the 'load-extension' flag to start a instance with custom extensions
sigma/proc_creation_win_browsers_chromiu.author: sigma

labels.label: Suspicious Chromium Browser Instance Executed With Custom Extensions

sigma/proc_creation_win_browsers_msedge_.description: Detects usage of the "msedge.exe" binary as a LOLBIN to download arbitrary file via the CLI
sigma/proc_creation_win_browsers_msedge_.author: sigma

labels.label: Potential Arbitrary File Download Via MSEdge.EXE

sigma/proc_creation_win_browsers_remote_.description: Detects browsers starting with the remote debugging flags. Which is a technique often used to perform browser injection attacks
sigma/proc_creation_win_browsers_remote_.author: sigma

sigma/proc_creation_win_browsers_tor_exe.description: Detects the use of Tor or Tor-Browser to connect to onion routing networks
sigma/proc_creation_win_browsers_tor_exe.author: sigma

sigma/proc_creation_win_certmgr_certific.description:
Detects execution of "certmgr" with the "add" flag in order to install a new certificate on the system.
Adversaries may install a root certificate on a compromised system to avoid warnings when connecting to adversary controlled web servers.
sigma/proc_creation_win_certmgr_certific.author: sigma

labels.label: New Root Certificate Installed Via CertMgr.EXE

sigma/proc_creation_win_certoc_load_dll.description: Detects when a user installs certificates by using CertOC.exe to loads the target DLL file.
sigma/proc_creation_win_certoc_load_dll.author: sigma

sigma/proc_creation_win_certoc_load_dll_.description: Detects when a user installs certificates by using CertOC.exe to load the target DLL file.
sigma/proc_creation_win_certoc_load_dll_.author: sigma

sigma/proc_creation_win_certutil_certifi.description:
Detects execution of "certutil" with the "addstore" flag in order to install a new certificate on the system.
Adversaries may install a root certificate on a compromised system to avoid warnings when connecting to adversary controlled web servers.
sigma/proc_creation_win_certutil_certifi.author: sigma

labels.label: New Root Certificate Installed Via Certutil.EXE

sigma/proc_creation_win_certutil_decode.description: Detects the execution of certutil with either the "decode" or "decodehex" flags to decode base64 or hex encoded files. This can be abused by attackers to decode an encoded payload before execution
sigma/proc_creation_win_certutil_decode.author: sigma

labels.label: File Decoded From Base64/Hex Via Certutil.EXE

sigma/proc_creation_win_certutil_downloa.description: Detects the execution of certutil with certain flags that allow the utility to download files.
sigma/proc_creation_win_certutil_downloa.author: sigma

sigma/proc_creation_win_certutil_downloa.description: Detects the execution of certutil with certain flags that allow the utility to download files from direct IPs.
sigma/proc_creation_win_certutil_downloa.author: sigma

labels.label: Suspicious File Downloaded From Direct IP Via Certutil.EXE

sigma/proc_creation_win_certutil_downloa.description: Detects the execution of certutil with certain flags that allow the utility to download files from file-sharing websites.
sigma/proc_creation_win_certutil_downloa.author: sigma

labels.label: Suspicious File Downloaded From File-Sharing Website Via Certutil.EXE

sigma/proc_creation_win_certutil_encode.description: Detects the execution of certutil with the "encode" flag to encode a file to base64. This can be abused by threat actors and attackers for data exfiltration
sigma/proc_creation_win_certutil_encode.author: sigma

labels.label: File Encoded To Base64 Via Certutil.EXE

sigma/proc_creation_win_certutil_encode_.description: Detects the execution of certutil with the "encode" flag to encode a file to base64 where the extensions of the file is suspicious
sigma/proc_creation_win_certutil_encode_.author: sigma

labels.label: Suspicious File Encoded To Base64 Via Certutil.EXE

sigma/proc_creation_win_certutil_encode_.description: Detects the execution of certutil with the "encode" flag to encode a file to base64 where the files are located in potentially suspicious locations
sigma/proc_creation_win_certutil_encode_.author: sigma

labels.label: File In Suspicious Location Encoded To Base64 Via Certutil.EXE

sigma/proc_creation_win_certutil_export_.description: Detects the execution of the certutil with the "exportPFX" flag which allows the utility to export certificates.
sigma/proc_creation_win_certutil_export_.author: sigma

sigma/proc_creation_win_certutil_ntlm_co.description: Detects possible NTLM coercion via certutil using the 'syncwithWU' flag
sigma/proc_creation_win_certutil_ntlm_co.author: sigma

sigma/proc_creation_win_chcp_codepage_lo.description: Detects use of chcp to look up the system locale value as part of host discovery
sigma/proc_creation_win_chcp_codepage_lo.author: sigma

sigma/proc_creation_win_chcp_codepage_sw.description: Detects a code page switch in command line or batch scripts to a rare language
sigma/proc_creation_win_chcp_codepage_sw.author: sigma

sigma/proc_creation_win_cipher_overwrite.description:
Detects usage of the "cipher" built-in utility in order to overwrite deleted data from disk.
Adversaries may destroy data and files on specific systems or in large numbers on a network to interrupt availability to systems, services, and network resources.
Data destruction is likely to render stored data irrecoverable by forensic techniques through overwriting files or data on local and remote drives
sigma/proc_creation_win_cipher_overwrite.author: sigma

sigma/proc_creation_win_citrix_trolleyex.description: Detects a possible process memory dump that uses the white-listed Citrix TrolleyExpress.exe filename as a way to dump the lsass process memory
sigma/proc_creation_win_citrix_trolleyex.author: sigma

sigma/proc_creation_win_clip_execution.description: Detects the execution of clip.exe in order to copy data to the clipboard. Adversaries may collect data stored in the clipboard from users copying information within or between applications.
sigma/proc_creation_win_clip_execution.author: sigma

labels.label: Data Copied To Clipboard Via Clip.EXE

sigma/proc_creation_win_cloudflared_tunn.description: Detects execution of the "cloudflared" tool with the tunnel "cleanup" flag in order to cleanup tunnel connections.
sigma/proc_creation_win_cloudflared_tunn.author: sigma

sigma/proc_creation_win_cloudflared_tunn.description: Detects execution of the "cloudflared" tool to connect back to a tunnel. This was seen used by threat actors to maintain persistence and remote access to compromised networks.
sigma/proc_creation_win_cloudflared_tunn.author: sigma

sigma/proc_creation_win_cmd_assoc_execut.description:
Detects file association changes using the builtin "assoc" command.
When a file is opened, the default program used to open the file (also called the file association or handler) is checked. File association selections are stored in the Windows Registry and can be edited by users, administrators, or programs that have Registry access or by administrators using the built-in assoc utility. Applications can modify the file association for a given file extension to call an arbitrary program when a file with the given extension is opened.
sigma/proc_creation_win_cmd_assoc_execut.author: sigma

labels.label: Change Default File Association Via Assoc

sigma/proc_creation_win_cmd_assoc_tamper.description:
Detects when a program changes the default file association of any extension to an executable.
When a file is opened, the default program used to open the file (also called the file association or handler) is checked. File association selections are stored in the Windows Registry and can be edited by users, administrators, or programs that have Registry access or by administrators using the built-in assoc utility. Applications can modify the file association for a given file extension to call an arbitrary program when a file with the given extension is opened.
sigma/proc_creation_win_cmd_assoc_tamper.author: sigma

labels.label: Change Default File Association To Executable Via Assoc

sigma/proc_creation_win_cmd_copy_dmp_fro.description: Detects usage of the copy builtin cmd command to copy files with the ".dmp"/".dump" extension from a remote share
sigma/proc_creation_win_cmd_copy_dmp_fro.author: sigma

labels.label: Copy .DMP/.DUMP Files From Remote Share Via Cmd.EXE

sigma/proc_creation_win_cmd_curl_downloa.description: Adversaries can use curl to download payloads remotely and execute them. Curl is included by default in Windows 10 build 17063 and later.
sigma/proc_creation_win_cmd_curl_downloa.author: sigma

sigma/proc_creation_win_cmd_del_executio.description:
Detects execution of the builtin "del"/"erase" commands in order to delete files.
Adversaries may delete files left behind by the actions of their intrusion activity.
Malware, tools, or other non-native files dropped or created on a system by an adversary may leave traces to indicate to what was done within a network and how.
Removal of these files can occur during an intrusion, or as part of a post-intrusion process to minimize the adversary's footprint.
sigma/proc_creation_win_cmd_del_executio.author: sigma

sigma/proc_creation_win_cmd_del_greedy_d.description: Detects execution of the "del" builtin command to remove files using greedy/wildcard expression. This is often used by malware to delete content of folders that perhaps contains the initial malware infection or to delete evidence.
sigma/proc_creation_win_cmd_del_greedy_d.author: sigma

sigma/proc_creation_win_cmd_dir_executio.description: Detects usage of the "dir" command that is part of Windows batch/cmd to collect information about directories
sigma/proc_creation_win_cmd_dir_executio.author: sigma

labels.label: Files And Subdirectories Listing Using Dir

sigma/proc_creation_win_cmd_dosfuscation.description: Detects possible payload obfuscation via the commandline
sigma/proc_creation_win_cmd_dosfuscation.author: sigma

sigma/proc_creation_win_cmd_http_appdata.description: Detects a suspicious command line execution that includes an URL and AppData string in the command line parameters as used by several droppers (js/vbs > powershell)
sigma/proc_creation_win_cmd_http_appdata.author: sigma

labels.label: Command Line Execution with Suspicious URL and AppData Strings

sigma/proc_creation_win_cmd_mklink_osk_c.description: Detects the creation of a symbolic link between "cmd.exe" and the accessibility on-screen keyboard binary (osk.exe) using "mklink". This technique provides an elevated command prompt to the user from the login screen without the need to log in.
sigma/proc_creation_win_cmd_mklink_osk_c.author: sigma

labels.label: Potential Privilege Escalation Using Symlink Between Osk and Cmd

sigma/proc_creation_win_cmd_mklink_shado.description: Shadow Copies storage symbolic link creation using operating systems utilities
sigma/proc_creation_win_cmd_mklink_shado.author: sigma

sigma/proc_creation_win_cmd_net_use_and_.description: Detects the execution of the "net use" command to mount a WebDAV server and then immediately execute some content in it. As seen being used in malicious LNK files
sigma/proc_creation_win_cmd_net_use_and_.author: sigma

labels.label: Suspicious File Execution From Internet Hosted WebDav Share

sigma/proc_creation_win_cmd_no_space_exe.description:
Detects Windows command lines that miss a space before or after the /c flag when running a command using the cmd.exe.
This could be a sign of obfuscation of a fat finger problem (typo by the developer).
sigma/proc_creation_win_cmd_no_space_exe.author: sigma

labels.label: Cmd.EXE Missing Space Characters Execution Anomaly

sigma/proc_creation_win_cmd_ntdllpipe_re.description: Detects command that type the content of ntdll.dll to a different file or a pipe in order to evade AV / EDR detection. As seen being used in the POC NtdllPipe
sigma/proc_creation_win_cmd_ntdllpipe_re.author: sigma

sigma/proc_creation_win_cmd_path_travers.description: Detects potential path traversal attempt via cmd.exe. Could indicate possible command/argument confusion/hijacking
sigma/proc_creation_win_cmd_path_travers.author: sigma

labels.label: Potential CommandLine Path Traversal Via Cmd.EXE

sigma/proc_creation_win_cmd_ping_del_com.description: Detects a method often used by ransomware. Which combines the "ping" to wait a couple of seconds and then "del" to delete the file in question. Its used to hide the file responsible for the initial infection for example
sigma/proc_creation_win_cmd_ping_del_com.author: sigma

sigma/proc_creation_win_cmd_redirect.description: Detects the use of the redirection character ">" to redicrect information in commandline
sigma/proc_creation_win_cmd_redirect.author: sigma

sigma/proc_creation_win_cmd_redirection_.description: Detects inline Windows shell commands redirecting output via the ">" symbol to a suspicious location
sigma/proc_creation_win_cmd_redirection_.author: sigma

sigma/proc_creation_win_cmd_rmdir_execut.description:
Detects execution of the builtin "rmdir" command in order to delete directories.
Adversaries may delete files left behind by the actions of their intrusion activity.
Malware, tools, or other non-native files dropped or created on a system by an adversary may leave traces to indicate to what was done within a network and how.
Removal of these files can occur during an intrusion, or as part of a post-intrusion process to minimize the adversary's footprint.
sigma/proc_creation_win_cmd_rmdir_execut.author: sigma

sigma/proc_creation_win_cmd_shadowcopy_a.description: Detects the execution of the builtin "copy" command that targets a shadow copy (sometimes used to copy registry hives that are in use)
sigma/proc_creation_win_cmd_shadowcopy_a.author: sigma

sigma/proc_creation_win_cmd_stdin_redire.description: Detect the use of "<" to read and potentially execute a file via cmd.exe
sigma/proc_creation_win_cmd_stdin_redire.author: sigma

labels.label: Read Contents From Stdin Via Cmd.EXE

sigma/proc_creation_win_cmd_sticky_key_l.description: Detects the usage and installation of a backdoor that uses an option to register a malicious debugger for built-in tools that are accessible in the login screen
sigma/proc_creation_win_cmd_sticky_key_l.author: sigma

sigma/proc_creation_win_cmd_sticky_keys_.description:
By replacing the sticky keys executable with the local admins CMD executable, an attacker is able to access a privileged windows console session without authenticating to the system.
When the sticky keys are "activated" the privilleged shell is launched.
sigma/proc_creation_win_cmd_sticky_keys_.author: sigma

sigma/proc_creation_win_cmd_unusual_pare.description: Detects suspicious parent process for cmd.exe
sigma/proc_creation_win_cmd_unusual_pare.author: sigma

sigma/proc_creation_win_cmdkey_adding_ge.description: Detects usage of cmdkey to add generic credentials. As an example, this has to be used before connecting to an RDP session via command line interface.
sigma/proc_creation_win_cmdkey_adding_ge.author: sigma

labels.label: New Generic Credentials Added Via Cmdkey.EXE

sigma/proc_creation_win_cmdkey_recon.description: Detects usage of cmdkey to look for cached credentials on the system
sigma/proc_creation_win_cmdkey_recon.author: sigma

labels.label: Potential Reconnaissance For Cached Credentials Via Cmdkey.EXE

sigma/proc_creation_win_cmstp_execution_.description: Detects various indicators of Microsoft Connection Manager Profile Installer execution
sigma/proc_creation_win_cmstp_execution_.author: sigma

sigma/proc_creation_win_conhost_legacy_o.description: ForceV1 asks for information directly from the kernel space. Conhost connects to the console application. High IntegrityLevel means the process is running with elevated privileges, such as an Administrator context.
sigma/proc_creation_win_conhost_legacy_o.author: sigma

labels.label: Suspicious High IntegrityLevel Conhost Legacy Option

sigma/proc_creation_win_conhost_path_tra.description: detects the usage of path traversal in conhost.exe indicating possible command/argument confusion/hijacking
sigma/proc_creation_win_conhost_path_tra.author: sigma

sigma/proc_creation_win_conhost_susp_chi.description: Detects uncommon "conhost" child processes. This could be a sign of "conhost" usage as a LOLBIN or potential process injection activity.
sigma/proc_creation_win_conhost_susp_chi.author: sigma

sigma/proc_creation_win_conhost_uncommon.description: Detects when the Console Window Host (conhost.exe) process is spawned by an uncommon parent process, which could be indicative of potential code injection activity.
sigma/proc_creation_win_conhost_uncommon.author: sigma

labels.label: Conhost Spawned By Uncommon Parent Process

sigma/proc_creation_win_control_panel_it.description: Detects the malicious use of a control panel item

sigma/proc_creation_win_lolbin_susp_cert.description: Detects a suspicious certreq execution taken from the LOLBAS examples, which can be abused to download (small) files

sigma/proc_creation_win_lolbin_wuauclt.description: Detects the use of the Windows Update Client binary (wuauclt.exe) to proxy execute code.

sigma/proc_creation_win_lolscript_regist.description: Detects potential abuse of the "register_app.vbs" script that is part of the Windows SDK. The script offers the capability to register new VSS/VDS Provider as a COM+ application. Attackers can use this to install malicious DLLs for persistence and execution.

sigma/proc_creation_win_malware_conti_sh.description: Detects a command that accesses password storing registry hives via volume shadow backups
sigma/proc_creation_win_malware_conti_sh.author: sigma

sigma/proc_creation_win_malware_script_d.description: Detects wscript/cscript executions of scripts located in user directories

sigma/proc_creation_win_mmc_mmc20_latera.description: Detects MMC20.Application Lateral Movement; specifically looks for the spawning of the parent MMC.exe with a command line of "-Embedding" as a child of svchost.exe

sigma/proc_creation_win_mofcomp_executio.description:
Detects execution of the "mofcomp" utility as a child of a suspicious shell or script running utility or by having a supsicious path in the commandline.
The "mofcomp" utility parses a file containing MOF statements and adds the classes and class instances defined in the file to the WMI repository.
Attackers abuse this utility to install malicious MOF scripts
sigma/proc_creation_win_mofcomp_executio.author: sigma

sigma/proc_creation_win_mpcmdrun_dll_sid.description: Detects execution of Microsoft Defender's CLI process (MpCmdRun.exe) from the non-default directory which may be an attempt to sideload arbitrary DLL
sigma/proc_creation_win_mpcmdrun_dll_sid.author: sigma

sigma/proc_creation_win_mpcmdrun_remove_.description: Adversaries may disable security tools to avoid possible detection of their tools and activities by removing Windows Defender Definition Files
sigma/proc_creation_win_mpcmdrun_remove_.author: sigma

sigma/proc_creation_win_msbuild_susp_par.description: Detects suspicious execution of 'Msbuild.exe' by a uncommon parent process
sigma/proc_creation_win_msbuild_susp_par.author: sigma

labels.label: Suspicious Msbuild Execution By Uncommon Parent Process

labels.label: Remotely Hosted HTA File Executed Via Mshta.EXE

sigma/proc_creation_win_mshta_inline_vbs.description: Detects the presence of the keywords "Wscript", "Shell" and "Run" in the command, which could indicate a suspicious activity
sigma/proc_creation_win_mshta_inline_vbs.author: sigma

sigma/proc_creation_win_mshta_javascript.description: Detects execution of javascript code using "mshta.exe".
sigma/proc_creation_win_mshta_javascript.author: sigma

sigma/proc_creation_win_mshta_susp_patte.description: Detects suspicious mshta process execution patterns
sigma/proc_creation_win_mshta_susp_patte.author: sigma

sigma/proc_creation_win_msiexec_dll.author: sigma

sigma/proc_creation_win_msiexec_embeddin.author: sigma

sigma/proc_creation_win_msiexec_execute_.description:
Adversaries may abuse msiexec.exe to proxy execution of malicious payloads.
Msiexec.exe is the command-line utility for the Windows Installer and is thus commonly associated with executing installation packages (.msi)
sigma/proc_creation_win_msiexec_execute_.author: sigma

sigma/proc_creation_win_msiexec_install_.description:
Adversaries may abuse msiexec.exe to proxy execution of malicious payloads.
Msiexec.exe is the command-line utility for the Windows Installer and is thus commonly associated with executing installation packages (.msi)
sigma/proc_creation_win_msiexec_install_.author: sigma

sigma/proc_creation_win_msiexec_install_.description: Detects usage of Msiexec.exe to install packages hosted remotely quietly
sigma/proc_creation_win_msiexec_install_.author: sigma

labels.label: Suspicious Msiexec Quiet Install From Remote Location

sigma/proc_creation_win_msiexec_masquera.description: Detects the execution of msiexec.exe from an uncommon directory
sigma/proc_creation_win_msiexec_masquera.author: sigma

sigma/proc_creation_win_msiexec_web_inst.description: Detects suspicious msiexec process starts with web addresses as parameter
sigma/proc_creation_win_msiexec_web_inst.author: sigma

sigma/proc_creation_win_mssql_sqlps_susp.description:
This rule detects execution of a PowerShell code through the sqlps.exe utility, which is included in the standard set of utilities supplied with the MSSQL Server.
Script blocks are not logged in this case, so this utility helps to bypass protection mechanisms based on the analysis of these logs.
sigma/proc_creation_win_mssql_sqlps_susp.author: sigma

labels.label: Detection of PowerShell Execution via Sqlps.exe

sigma/proc_creation_win_mssql_sqltoolsps.description:
This rule detects execution of a PowerShell code through the sqltoolsps.exe utility, which is included in the standard set of utilities supplied with the Microsoft SQL Server Management studio.
Script blocks are not logged in this case, so this utility helps to bypass protection mechanisms based on the analysis of these logs.
sigma/proc_creation_win_mssql_sqltoolsps.author: sigma

labels.label: SQL Client Tools PowerShell Session Detection

sigma/proc_creation_win_mssql_susp_child.description: Detects suspicious child processes of the SQLServer process. This could indicate potential RCE or SQL Injection.

sigma/proc_creation_win_mstsc_run_local_.description: Detects potential RDP connection via Mstsc using a local ".rdp" file located in suspicious locations.

sigma/proc_creation_win_mstsc_run_local_.description: Detects potential RDP connection via Mstsc using a local ".rdp" file located in suspicious locations.
sigma/proc_creation_win_mstsc_run_local_.author: sigma

sigma/proc_creation_win_net_stop_service.author: sigma

sigma/proc_creation_win_net_use_mount_sh.author: sigma

sigma/proc_creation_win_netsh_fw_disable.author: sigma

An adversary may place a network interface into promiscuous mode to passively access data in transit over the network, or use span ports to capture a larger amount of data.

sigma/proc_creation_win_nltest_execution.description: Detects nltest commands that can be used for information discovery

sigma/proc_creation_win_nltest_recon.description: Detects nltest commands that can be used for information discovery
sigma/proc_creation_win_nltest_recon.author: sigma

sigma/proc_creation_win_node_abuse.description: Detects the execution node.exe which is shipped with multiple software such as VMware, Adobe...etc. In order to execute arbitrary code. For example to establish reverse shell as seen in Log4j attacks...etc

sigma/proc_creation_win_node_adobe_creat.description: Detects the execution of other scripts using the Node executable packaged with Adobe Creative Cloud

sigma/proc_creation_win_odbcconf_registe.description: Detects execution of "odbcconf" with the "REGSVR" action where the DLL in question doesn't contain a ".dll" extension. Which is often used as a method to evade defenses.

sigma/proc_creation_win_pua_iox.author: sigma

sigma/proc_creation_win_pua_mouselock_ex.description: In Kaspersky's 2020 Incident Response Analyst Report they listed legitimate tool "Mouse Lock" as being used for both credential access and collection in security incidents.
sigma/proc_creation_win_pua_mouselock_ex.author: sigma

sigma/proc_creation_win_pua_netcat.description: Detects execution of Netcat. Adversaries may use a non-application layer protocol for communication between host and C2 server or among infected hosts within a network
sigma/proc_creation_win_pua_netcat.author: sigma

sigma/proc_creation_win_pua_ngrok.description:
Detects the use of Ngrok, a utility used for port forwarding and tunneling, often used by threat actors to make local protected services publicly available.
Involved domains are bin.equinox.io for download and *.ngrok.io for connections.
sigma/proc_creation_win_pua_ngrok.author: sigma

sigma/proc_creation_win_pua_nimgrab.description: Detects the usage of nimgrab, a tool bundled with the Nim programming framework and used for downloading files.
sigma/proc_creation_win_pua_nimgrab.author: sigma

sigma/proc_creation_win_pua_nircmd.description: Detects the use of NirCmd tool for command execution, which could be the result of legitimate administrative activity
sigma/proc_creation_win_pua_nircmd.author: sigma

sigma/proc_creation_win_pua_nircmd_as_sy.description: Detects the use of NirCmd tool for command execution as SYSTEM user
sigma/proc_creation_win_pua_nircmd_as_sy.author: sigma

labels.label: PUA - NirCmd Execution As LOCAL SYSTEM

sigma/proc_creation_win_pua_nmap_zenmap.description: Detects usage of namp/zenmap. Adversaries may attempt to get a listing of services running on remote hosts, including those that may be vulnerable to remote software exploitation
sigma/proc_creation_win_pua_nmap_zenmap.author: sigma

sigma/proc_creation_win_pua_nps.description: Detects the use of NPS, a port forwarding and intranet penetration proxy server
sigma/proc_creation_win_pua_nps.author: sigma

sigma/proc_creation_win_pua_nsudo.description: Detects the use of NSudo tool for command execution
sigma/proc_creation_win_pua_nsudo.author: sigma

sigma/proc_creation_win_pua_process_hack.description: Detects the execution of Process Hacker based on binary metadata information (Image, Hash, Imphash, etc). Process Hacker is a tool to view and manipulate processes, kernel options and other low level options. Threat actors regularly abuse it to manipulate system processes.
sigma/proc_creation_win_pua_process_hack.author: sigma

sigma/proc_creation_win_pua_radmin.description: Detects the execution of Radmin which can be abused by an adversary to remotely control Windows machines
sigma/proc_creation_win_pua_radmin.author: sigma

sigma/proc_creation_win_pua_rcedit_execu.description: Detects the use of rcedit to potentially alter executable PE metadata properties, which could conceal efforts to rename system utilities for defense evasion.
sigma/proc_creation_win_pua_rcedit_execu.author: sigma

labels.label: PUA - Potential PE Metadata Tamper Using Rcedit

sigma/proc_creation_win_pua_rclone_execu.description: Detects execution of RClone utility for exfiltration as used by various ransomwares strains like REvil, Conti, FiveHands, etc
sigma/proc_creation_win_pua_rclone_execu.author: sigma

sigma/proc_creation_win_pua_runxcmd.description: Detects the use of the RunXCmd tool to execute commands with System or TrustedInstaller accounts
sigma/proc_creation_win_pua_runxcmd.author: sigma

sigma/proc_creation_win_pua_seatbelt.description: Detects the execution of the PUA/Recon tool Seatbelt via PE information of command line parameters
sigma/proc_creation_win_pua_seatbelt.author: sigma

sigma/proc_creation_win_pua_system_infor.description: Detects the execution of System Informer, a task manager tool to view and manipulate processes, kernel options and other low level operations
sigma/proc_creation_win_pua_system_infor.author: sigma

sigma/proc_creation_win_pua_webbrowserpa.description: Detects the execution of WebBrowserPassView.exe. A password recovery tool that reveals the passwords stored by the following Web browsers, Internet Explorer (Version 4.0 - 11.0), Mozilla Firefox (All Versions), Google Chrome, Safari, and Opera
sigma/proc_creation_win_pua_webbrowserpa.author: sigma

sigma/proc_creation_win_pua_wsudo_susp_e.description: Detects usage of wsudo (Windows Sudo Utility). Which is a tool that let the user execute programs with different permissions (System, Trusted Installer, Administrator...etc)
sigma/proc_creation_win_pua_wsudo_susp_e.author: sigma

sigma/proc_creation_win_python_adidnsdum.description:
This tool enables enumeration and exporting of all DNS records in the zone for recon purposes of internal networks Python 3 and python.exe must be installed,
Usee to Query/modify DNS records for Active Directory integrated DNS via LDAP
sigma/proc_creation_win_python_adidnsdum.author: sigma

sigma/proc_creation_win_python_inline_co.description: Detects execution of python using the "-c" flag. This is could be used as a way to launch a reverse shell or execute live python code.
sigma/proc_creation_win_python_inline_co.author: sigma

sigma/proc_creation_win_python_pty_spawn.description: Detects python spawning a pretty tty
sigma/proc_creation_win_python_pty_spawn.author: sigma

labels.label: Python Spawning Pretty TTY on Windows

sigma/proc_creation_win_query_session_ex.description: Detects usage of "query.exe" a system binary to exfil information such as "sessions" and "processes" for later use
sigma/proc_creation_win_query_session_ex.author: sigma

sigma/proc_creation_win_rar_compress_dat.description: Detects usage of "rar" to add files to an archive for potential compression. An adversary may compress data (e.g. sensitive documents) that is collected prior to exfiltration in order to make it portable and minimize the amount of data sent over the network.
sigma/proc_creation_win_rar_compress_dat.author: sigma

labels.label: Files Added To An Archive Using Rar.EXE

sigma/proc_creation_win_rar_compression_.description: Detects the use of rar.exe, on the command line, to create an archive with password protection or with a specific compression level. This is pretty indicative of malicious actions.
sigma/proc_creation_win_rar_compression_.author: sigma

labels.label: Rar Usage with Password and Compression Level

sigma/proc_creation_win_rar_susp_greedy_.description: Detects RAR usage that creates an archive from a suspicious folder, either a system folder or one of the folders often used by attackers for staging purposes
sigma/proc_creation_win_rar_susp_greedy_.author: sigma

sigma/proc_creation_win_rasdial_executio.description: Detects suspicious process related to rasdial.exe
sigma/proc_creation_win_rasdial_executio.author: sigma

sigma/proc_creation_win_rdrleakdiag_proc.description: Detects the use of the Microsoft Windows Resource Leak Diagnostic tool "rdrleakdiag.exe" to dump process memory
sigma/proc_creation_win_rdrleakdiag_proc.author: sigma

sigma/proc_creation_win_reg_add_run_key.description: Detects suspicious command line reg.exe tool adding key to RUN key in Registry
sigma/proc_creation_win_reg_add_run_key.author: sigma

labels.label: Potential Persistence Attempt Via Run Keys Using Reg.EXE

sigma/proc_creation_win_reg_add_safeboot.description: Detects execution of "reg.exe" commands with the "add" or "copy" flags on safe boot registry keys. Often used by attacker to allow the ransomware to work in safe mode as some security products do not
sigma/proc_creation_win_reg_add_safeboot.author: sigma

labels.label: Add SafeBoot Keys Via Reg Utility

sigma/proc_creation_win_reg_bitlocker.description: Detects suspicious addition to BitLocker related registry keys via the reg.exe utility
sigma/proc_creation_win_reg_bitlocker.author: sigma

sigma/proc_creation_win_reg_credential_a.description: Detects dropping of dll files in system32 that may be used to retrieve user credentials from LSASS
sigma/proc_creation_win_reg_credential_a.author: sigma

sigma/proc_creation_win_reg_defender_exc.description: Detects the usage of "reg.exe" to add Defender folder exclusions. Qbot has been seen using this technique to add exlcusions for folders within AppData and ProgramData.
sigma/proc_creation_win_reg_defender_exc.author: sigma

labels.label: Suspicious Windows Defender Folder Exclusion Added Via Reg.EXE

sigma/proc_creation_win_reg_delete_safeb.description: Detects execution of "reg.exe" commands with the "delete" flag on safe boot registry keys. Often used by attacker to prevent safeboot execution of security products
sigma/proc_creation_win_reg_delete_safeb.author: sigma

labels.label: SafeBoot Registry Key Deleted Via Reg.EXE

sigma/proc_creation_win_reg_delete_servi.description: Detects execution of "reg.exe" commands with the "delete" flag on services registry key. Often used by attacker to remove AV software services
sigma/proc_creation_win_reg_delete_servi.author: sigma

labels.label: Service Registry Key Deleted Via Reg.EXE

sigma/proc_creation_win_reg_direct_asep_.description: Detects direct modification of autostart extensibility point (ASEP) in registry using reg.exe.
sigma/proc_creation_win_reg_direct_asep_.author: sigma

sigma/proc_creation_win_reg_disable_sec_.description: Detects execution of "reg.exe" to disable security services such as Windows Defender.
sigma/proc_creation_win_reg_disable_sec_.author: sigma

sigma/proc_creation_win_reg_dumping_sens.description: Detects the usage of "reg.exe" in order to dump sensitive registry hives, which includes SAM, SYSTEM and SECURITY
sigma/proc_creation_win_reg_dumping_sens.author: sigma

labels.label: Dumping of Sensitive Hives Via Reg.EXE

sigma/proc_creation_win_reg_enumeration_.description:
Adversaries may search the Registry on compromised systems for insecurely stored credentials.
The Windows Registry stores configuration information that can be used by the system or other programs.
Adversaries may query the Registry looking for credentials and passwords that have been stored for use by other programs or services
sigma/proc_creation_win_reg_enumeration_.author: sigma

sigma/proc_creation_win_reg_import_from_.description: Detects the import of '.reg' files from suspicious paths using the 'reg.exe' utility
sigma/proc_creation_win_reg_import_from_.author: sigma

labels.label: Potential Suspicious Registry File Imported Via Reg.EXE

sigma/proc_creation_win_reg_lsa_disable_.description:
Detect activation of DisableRestrictedAdmin to desable RestrictedAdmin mode.
RestrictedAdmin mode prevents the transmission of reusable credentials to the remote system to which you connect using Remote Desktop.
This prevents your credentials from being harvested during the initial connection process if the remote server has been compromise
sigma/proc_creation_win_reg_lsa_disable_.author: sigma

sigma/proc_creation_win_reg_lsa_ppl_prot.description: Detects the usage of the "reg.exe" utility to disable PPL protection on the LSA process
sigma/proc_creation_win_reg_lsa_ppl_prot.author: sigma

labels.label: LSA PPL Protection Disabled Via Reg.EXE

sigma/proc_creation_win_reg_machineguid.description: Use of reg to get MachineGuid information
sigma/proc_creation_win_reg_machineguid.author: sigma

sigma/proc_creation_win_reg_modify_group.description: Detect malicious GPO modifications can be used to implement many other malicious behaviors.
sigma/proc_creation_win_reg_modify_group.author: sigma

sigma/proc_creation_win_reg_open_command.description: Threat actors performed dumping of SAM, SECURITY and SYSTEM registry hives using DelegateExecute key
sigma/proc_creation_win_reg_open_command.author: sigma

sigma/proc_creation_win_reg_query_regist.description: Detects the usage of "reg.exe" in order to query reconnaissance information from the registry. Adversaries may interact with the Windows registry to gather information about credentials, the system, configuration, and installed software.
sigma/proc_creation_win_reg_query_regist.author: sigma

labels.label: Potential Configuration And Service Reconnaissance Via Reg.EXE

sigma/proc_creation_win_reg_rdp_keys_tam.description: Detects the execution of "reg.exe" for enabling/disabling the RDP service on the host by tampering with the 'CurrentControlSet\Control\Terminal Server' values
sigma/proc_creation_win_reg_rdp_keys_tam.author: sigma

labels.label: Potential Tampering With RDP Related Registry Keys Via Reg.EXE

sigma/proc_creation_win_reg_screensaver.description:
Adversaries may establish persistence by executing malicious content triggered by user inactivity.
Screensavers are programs that execute after a configurable time of user inactivity and consist of Portable Executable (PE) files with a .scr file extension
sigma/proc_creation_win_reg_screensaver.author: sigma

sigma/proc_creation_win_reg_service_imag.description:
Adversaries may execute their own malicious payloads by hijacking the Registry entries used by services.
Adversaries may use flaws in the permissions for registry to redirect from the originally specified executable to one that they control, in order to launch their own code at Service start.
Windows stores local service configuration information in the Registry under HKLM\SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Services
sigma/proc_creation_win_reg_service_imag.author: sigma

labels.label: Changing Existing Service ImagePath Value Via Reg.EXE

sigma/proc_creation_win_reg_software_dis.description: Adversaries may attempt to enumerate software for a variety of reasons, such as figuring out what security measures are present or if the compromised system has a version of software that is vulnerable.
sigma/proc_creation_win_reg_software_dis.author: sigma

sigma/proc_creation_win_reg_susp_paths.description: Detects when an adversary uses the reg.exe utility to add or modify new keys or subkeys
sigma/proc_creation_win_reg_susp_paths.author: sigma

sigma/proc_creation_win_reg_volsnap_disa.description: Detects commands that temporarily turn off Volume Snapshots
sigma/proc_creation_win_reg_volsnap_disa.author: sigma

sigma/proc_creation_win_reg_windows_defe.description: Detects the usage of "reg.exe" to tamper with different Windows Defender registry keys in order to disable some important features related to protection and detection
sigma/proc_creation_win_reg_windows_defe.author: sigma

labels.label: Suspicious Windows Defender Registry Key Tampering Via Reg.EXE

sigma/proc_creation_win_reg_write_protec.description: Looks for changes to registry to disable any write-protect property for storage devices. This could be a precursor to a ransomware attack and has been an observed technique used by cypherpunk group.
sigma/proc_creation_win_reg_write_protec.author: sigma

sigma/proc_creation_win_regasm_suspiciou.description: Detects suspicious execution of Regasm/Regsvcs utilities
sigma/proc_creation_win_regasm_suspiciou.author: sigma

sigma/proc_creation_win_regedit_export_c.description: Detects the export of a crital Registry key to a file.
sigma/proc_creation_win_regedit_export_c.author: sigma

labels.label: Exports Critical Registry Keys To a File

sigma/proc_creation_win_regedit_export_k.description: Detects the export of the target Registry key to a file.
sigma/proc_creation_win_regedit_export_k.author: sigma

labels.label: Exports Registry Key To a File

sigma/proc_creation_win_regedit_import_k.description: Detects the import of the specified file to the registry with regedit.exe.
sigma/proc_creation_win_regedit_import_k.author: sigma

labels.label: Imports Registry Key From a File

sigma/proc_creation_win_regedit_import_k.description: Detects the import of a alternate datastream to the registry with regedit.exe.
sigma/proc_creation_win_regedit_import_k.author: sigma

labels.label: Imports Registry Key From an ADS

sigma/proc_creation_win_regedit_trustedi.description: Detects a regedit started with TrustedInstaller privileges or by ProcessHacker.exe
sigma/proc_creation_win_regedit_trustedi.author: sigma

sigma/proc_creation_win_regini_ads.description: Detects the import of an alternate data stream with regini.exe, regini.exe can be used to modify registry keys.
sigma/proc_creation_win_regini_ads.author: sigma

labels.label: Suspicious Registry Modification From ADS Via Regini.EXE

sigma/proc_creation_win_regini_execution.description: Detects the execution of regini.exe which can be used to modify registry keys, the changes are imported from one or more text files.
sigma/proc_creation_win_regini_execution.author: sigma

sigma/proc_creation_win_registry_cimprov.description: Detects using register-cimprovider.exe to execute arbitrary dll file.
sigma/proc_creation_win_registry_cimprov.author: sigma

sigma/proc_creation_win_registry_enumera.description: Detects processes that query known 3rd party registry keys that holds credentials via commandline
sigma/proc_creation_win_registry_enumera.author: sigma

labels.label: Enumeration for 3rd Party Creds From CLI

sigma/proc_creation_win_registry_install.description: Detects the registration of a debugger for a program that is available in the logon screen (sticky key backdoor).
sigma/proc_creation_win_registry_install.author: sigma

sigma/proc_creation_win_registry_logon_s.description: Detects the addition of a new LogonScript to the registry value "UserInitMprLogonScript" for potential persistence
sigma/proc_creation_win_registry_logon_s.author: sigma

labels.label: Potential Persistence Via Logon Scripts - CommandLine

sigma/proc_creation_win_registry_new_net.description: Detects when an attacker tries to add a new network provider in order to dump clear text credentials, similar to how the NPPSpy tool does it
sigma/proc_creation_win_registry_new_net.author: sigma

labels.label: Potential Credential Dumping Attempt Using New NetworkProvider - CLI

sigma/proc_creation_win_registry_privile.description: Detect modification of services configuration (ImagePath, FailureCommand and ServiceDLL) in registry by processes with Medium integrity level
sigma/proc_creation_win_registry_privile.author: sigma

labels.label: Potential Privilege Escalation via Service Permissions Weakness

sigma/proc_creation_win_registry_set_uns.description: Detects changes to the PowerShell execution policy registry key in order to bypass signing requirements for script execution from the CommandLine
sigma/proc_creation_win_registry_set_uns.author: sigma

labels.label: Potential PowerShell Execution Policy Tampering - ProcCreation

sigma/proc_creation_win_registry_typed_p.description: Detects modification addition to the 'TypedPaths' key in the user or admin registry via the commandline. Which might indicate persistence attempt
sigma/proc_creation_win_registry_typed_p.author: sigma

sigma/proc_creation_win_regsvr32_flags_a.description: Detects a potential command line flag anomaly related to "regsvr32" in which the "/i" flag is used without the "/n" which should be uncommon.
sigma/proc_creation_win_regsvr32_flags_a.author: sigma

sigma/proc_creation_win_regsvr32_http_ip.description: Detects regsvr32 execution to download and install DLLs located remotely where the address is an IP address.
sigma/proc_creation_win_regsvr32_http_ip.author: sigma

labels.label: Potentially Suspicious Regsvr32 HTTP IP Pattern

sigma/proc_creation_win_regsvr32_network.description: Detects regsvr32 execution to download/install/register new DLLs that are hosted on Web or FTP servers.
sigma/proc_creation_win_regsvr32_network.author: sigma

sigma/proc_creation_win_regsvr32_remote_.description: Detects REGSVR32.exe to execute DLL hosted on remote shares
sigma/proc_creation_win_regsvr32_remote_.author: sigma

labels.label: Suspicious Regsvr32 Execution From Remote Share

sigma/proc_creation_win_regsvr32_susp_ch.description: Detects potentially suspicious child processes of "regsvr32.exe".
sigma/proc_creation_win_regsvr32_susp_ch.author: sigma

labels.label: Potentially Suspicious Child Process Of Regsvr32

sigma/proc_creation_win_regsvr32_susp_ex.description: Detects execution of regsvr32 where the DLL is located in a potentially suspicious location.
sigma/proc_creation_win_regsvr32_susp_ex.author: sigma

labels.label: Regsvr32 Execution From Potential Suspicious Location

sigma/proc_creation_win_regsvr32_susp_ex.description: Detects execution of regsvr32 where the DLL is located in a highly suspicious locations
sigma/proc_creation_win_regsvr32_susp_ex.author: sigma

labels.label: Regsvr32 Execution From Highly Suspicious Location

sigma/proc_creation_win_regsvr32_susp_ex.description: Detects the execution of REGSVR32.exe with DLL files masquerading as other files
sigma/proc_creation_win_regsvr32_susp_ex.author: sigma

labels.label: Regsvr32 DLL Execution With Suspicious File Extension

sigma/proc_creation_win_regsvr32_susp_pa.description: Detects various command line and scripting engines/processes such as "PowerShell", "Wscript", "Cmd", etc. spawning a "regsvr32" instance.
sigma/proc_creation_win_regsvr32_susp_pa.author: sigma

sigma/proc_creation_win_regsvr32_uncommo.description: Detects a "regsvr32" execution where the DLL doesn't contain a common file extension.
sigma/proc_creation_win_regsvr32_uncommo.author: sigma

labels.label: Regsvr32 DLL Execution With Uncommon Extension

sigma/proc_creation_win_remote_access_so.description:
An adversary may use legitimate desktop support and remote access software, such as Team Viewer, Go2Assist, LogMein, AmmyyAdmin, etc, to establish an interactive command and control channel to target systems within networks.
These services are commonly used as legitimate technical support software, and may be allowed by application control within a target environment.
Remote access tools like VNC, Ammyy, and Teamviewer are used frequently when compared with other legitimate software commonly used by adversaries. (Citation: Symantec Living off the Land)
sigma/proc_creation_win_remote_access_so.author: sigma

labels.label: Use of UltraViewer Remote Access Software

sigma/proc_creation_win_remote_access_to.description:
An adversary may use legitimate desktop support and remote access software, such as Team Viewer, Go2Assist, LogMein, AmmyyAdmin, etc, to establish an interactive command and control channel to target systems within networks.
These services are commonly used as legitimate technical support software, and may be allowed by application control within a target environment.
Remote access tools like VNC, Ammyy, and Teamviewer are used frequently when compared with other legitimate software commonly used by adversaries. (Citation: Symantec Living off the Land)
sigma/proc_creation_win_remote_access_to.author: sigma

sigma/proc_creation_win_remote_access_to.description: Detects piping the password to an anydesk instance via CMD and the '--set-password' flag.
sigma/proc_creation_win_remote_access_to.author: sigma

labels.label: Remote Access Tool - AnyDesk Piped Password Via CLI

sigma/proc_creation_win_remote_access_to.description: Detects AnyDesk Remote Desktop silent installation. Which can be used by attackers to gain remote access.
sigma/proc_creation_win_remote_access_to.author: sigma

labels.label: Remote Access Tool - AnyDesk Silent Installation

sigma/proc_creation_win_remote_access_to.description:
An adversary may use legitimate desktop support and remote access software, such as Team Viewer, Go2Assist, LogMein, AmmyyAdmin, etc, to establish an interactive command and control channel to target systems within networks.
These services are commonly used as legitimate technical support software, and may be allowed by application control within a target environment.
Remote access tools like VNC, Ammyy, and Teamviewer are used frequently when compared with other legitimate software commonly used by adversaries. (Citation: Symantec Living off the Land)
sigma/proc_creation_win_remote_access_to.author: sigma

labels.label: Remote Access Tool - Anydesk Execution From Suspicious Folder

sigma/proc_creation_win_remote_access_to.description:

sigma/proc_creation_win_remote_access_to.author: sigma

sigma/proc_creation_win_remote_access_to.description: Detects execution of client32.exe (NetSupport RAT) from an unusual location (outside of 'C:\Program Files')
sigma/proc_creation_win_remote_access_to.author: sigma

labels.label: Remote Access Tool - NetSupport Execution From Unusual Location

sigma/proc_creation_win_remote_access_to.description: Detects execution of Remote Utilities RAT (RURAT) from an unusual location (outside of 'C:\Program Files')
sigma/proc_creation_win_remote_access_to.author: sigma

labels.label: Remote Access Tool - RURAT Execution From Unusual Location

sigma/proc_creation_win_remote_access_to.description:
An adversary may use legitimate desktop support and remote access software, such as Team Viewer, Go2Assist, LogMein, AmmyyAdmin, etc, to establish an interactive command and control channel to target systems within networks.
These services are commonly used as legitimate technical support software, and may be allowed by application control within a target environment.

sigma/proc_creation_win_remote_access_to.author: sigma

sigma/proc_creation_win_remote_access_to.description: Detects ScreenConnect program starts that establish a remote access to that system (not meeting, not remote support)
sigma/proc_creation_win_remote_access_to.author: sigma

labels.label: Remote Access Tool - ScreenConnect Suspicious Execution

sigma/proc_creation_win_remote_access_to.description: Detects suspicious sub processes started by the ScreenConnect client service, which indicates the use of the so-called Backstage mode
sigma/proc_creation_win_remote_access_to.author: sigma

labels.label: Remote Access Tool - ScreenConnect Backstage Mode Anomaly

sigma/proc_creation_win_remote_time_disc.description: Identifies use of various commands to query a systems time. This technique may be used before executing a scheduled task or to discover the time zone of a target system.
sigma/proc_creation_win_remote_time_disc.author: sigma

sigma/proc_creation_win_renamed_adfind.description: Detects the use of a renamed Adfind.exe. AdFind continues to be seen across majority of breaches. It is used to domain trust discovery to plan out subsequent steps in the attack chain.
sigma/proc_creation_win_renamed_adfind.author: sigma

sigma/proc_creation_win_renamed_autohotk.description: Detects execution of a renamed autohotkey.exe binary based on PE metadata fields
sigma/proc_creation_win_renamed_autohotk.author: sigma

sigma/proc_creation_win_renamed_autoit.description:
Detects the execution of a renamed AutoIt2.exe or AutoIt3.exe.
AutoIt is a scripting language and automation tool for Windows systems. While primarily used for legitimate automation tasks, it can be misused in cyber attacks.
Attackers can leverage AutoIt to create and distribute malware, including keyloggers, spyware, and botnets. A renamed AutoIt executable is particularly suspicious.
sigma/proc_creation_win_renamed_autoit.author: sigma

sigma/proc_creation_win_renamed_binary.description: Detects the execution of a renamed binary often used by attackers or malware leveraging new Sysmon OriginalFileName datapoint.
sigma/proc_creation_win_renamed_binary.author: sigma

labels.label: Potential Defense Evasion Via Binary Rename

sigma/proc_creation_win_renamed_binary_h.description: Detects the execution of a renamed binary often used by attackers or malware leveraging new Sysmon OriginalFileName datapoint.
sigma/proc_creation_win_renamed_binary_h.author: sigma

labels.label: Potential Defense Evasion Via Rename Of Highly Relevant Binaries

sigma/proc_creation_win_renamed_browserc.description: Detects process creation with a renamed BrowserCore.exe (used to extract Azure tokens)
sigma/proc_creation_win_renamed_browserc.author: sigma

sigma/proc_creation_win_renamed_createdu.description: Detects uses of a renamed legitimate createdump.exe LOLOBIN utility to dump process memory
sigma/proc_creation_win_renamed_createdu.author: sigma

sigma/proc_creation_win_rundll32_script_.author: sigma

INF file may contain instructions allowing to create values in the registry, modify files and install drivers. This technique could be used to obtain persistence via modifying one of Run or RunOnce registry keys, run process or use other DLLs chain calls (see references) InstallHinfSection function in setupapi.dll calls runonce.exe executable regardless of actual content of INF file.

This could be an indicator of exfiltration or use of WebDav to launch code (hosted on WebDav Server) or potentially a sign of exploitation of CVE-2023-23397

Detects when an attacker tries to modify an already existing scheduled tasks to run from a suspicious location
Attackers can create a simple looking task in order to avoid detection on creation as it's often the most focused on
Instead they modify the task after creation to include their malicious payload

sigma/proc_creation_win_setspn_spn_enume.author: sigma

sigma/proc_creation_win_sndvol_susp_chil.author: sigma

sigma/proc_creation_win_soundrecorder_au.author: sigma

sigma/proc_creation_win_splwow64_cli_ano.description: Detects suspicious Splwow64.exe process without any command line parameters
sigma/proc_creation_win_splwow64_cli_ano.author: sigma

sigma/proc_creation_win_spoolsv_susp_chi.description: Detects suspicious print spool service (spoolsv.exe) child processes.
sigma/proc_creation_win_spoolsv_susp_chi.author: sigma

sigma/proc_creation_win_sqlcmd_veeam_db_.description: Detects potentially suspicious SQL queries using SQLCmd targeting the Veeam backup databases in order to steal information.
sigma/proc_creation_win_sqlcmd_veeam_db_.author: sigma

sigma/proc_creation_win_sqlcmd_veeam_dum.description: Detects dump of credentials in VeeamBackup dbo
sigma/proc_creation_win_sqlcmd_veeam_dum.author: sigma

sigma/proc_creation_win_sqlite_chromium_.description: Detect usage of the "sqlite" binary to query databases in Chromium-based browsers for potential data stealing.

sigma/proc_creation_win_sqlite_firefox_g.description: Detect usage of the "sqlite" binary to query databases in Firefox and other Gecko-based browsers for potential data stealing.
sigma/proc_creation_win_sqlite_firefox_g.author: sigma

sigma/proc_creation_win_ssh_port_forward.description: Detects suspicious SSH tunnel port forwarding to a local port
sigma/proc_creation_win_ssh_port_forward.author: sigma

sigma/proc_creation_win_ssh_rdp_tunnelin.description: Execution of ssh.exe to perform data exfiltration and tunneling through RDP
sigma/proc_creation_win_ssh_rdp_tunnelin.author: sigma

sigma/proc_creation_win_susp_add_user_lo.description: Detects suspicious command line that adds an account to the local administrators/administrateurs group
sigma/proc_creation_win_susp_add_user_lo.author: sigma

sigma/proc_creation_win_susp_add_user_re.description: Detects suspicious command line in which a user gets added to the local Remote Desktop Users group
sigma/proc_creation_win_susp_add_user_re.author: sigma

sigma/proc_creation_win_susp_alternate_d.description: Detects execution from an Alternate Data Stream (ADS). Adversaries may use NTFS file attributes to hide their malicious data in order to evade detection
sigma/proc_creation_win_susp_alternate_d.author: sigma

sigma/proc_creation_win_susp_always_inst.description: Detects Windows Installer service (msiexec.exe) trying to install MSI packages with SYSTEM privilege

sigma/proc_creation_win_susp_arbitrary_s.description: The .SettingContent-ms file type was introduced in Windows 10 and allows a user to create "shortcuts" to various Windows 10 setting pages. These files are simply XML and contain paths to various Windows 10 settings binaries.

sigma/proc_creation_win_susp_archiver_is.description: Detects cases in which an ISO files is opend within an archiver like 7Zip or Winrar, which is a sign of phishing as threat actors put small ISO files in archives as email attachments to bypass certain filters and protective measures (mark of web)

sigma/proc_creation_win_susp_automated_c.description: Once established within a system or network, an adversary may use automated techniques for collecting internal data.

sigma/proc_creation_win_susp_bad_opsec_s.description:
Detects attackers using tooling with bad opsec defaults.
E.g. spawning a sacrificial process to inject a capability into the process without taking into account how the process is normally run.
One trivial example of this is using rundll32.exe without arguments as a sacrificial process (default in CS, now highlighted by c2lint), running WerFault without arguments (Kraken - credit am0nsec), and other examples.
sigma/proc_creation_win_susp_bad_opsec_s.author: sigma

labels.label: Bad Opsec Defaults Sacrificial Processes With Improper Arguments

sigma/proc_creation_win_susp_calc.description: Detects suspicious use of 'calc.exe' with command line parameters or in a suspicious directory, which is likely caused by some PoC or detection evasion
sigma/proc_creation_win_susp_calc.author: sigma

sigma/proc_creation_win_susp_child_proce.description: Detection of child processes spawned with SYSTEM privileges by parents with LOCAL SERVICE or NETWORK SERVICE accounts
sigma/proc_creation_win_susp_child_proce.author: sigma

sigma/proc_creation_win_susp_cli_obfusca.description: Detects potential commandline obfuscation using known escape characters

labels.label: Potential Commandline Obfuscation Using Escape Characters

sigma/proc_creation_win_susp_cli_obfusca.description:
Detects potential commandline obfuscation using unicode characters.
Adversaries may attempt to make an executable or file difficult to discover or analyze by encrypting, encoding, or otherwise obfuscating its contents on the system or in transit.
sigma/proc_creation_win_susp_cli_obfusca.author: sigma

labels.label: Potential Commandline Obfuscation Using Unicode Characters

sigma/proc_creation_win_susp_commandline.description: Detects potential evasion or obfuscation attempts using bogus path traversal via the commandline

sigma/proc_creation_win_susp_compression.description: Detects suspicious command line arguments of common data compression tools
sigma/proc_creation_win_susp_compression.author: sigma

sigma/proc_creation_win_susp_copy_browse.description:
Adversaries may acquire credentials from web browsers by reading files specific to the target browser.
Web browsers commonly save credentials such as website usernames and passwords so that they do not need to be entered manually in the future.
Web browsers typically store the credentials in an encrypted format within a credential store.

sigma/proc_creation_win_susp_copy_latera.description: Detects a suspicious copy command to or from an Admin share or remote
sigma/proc_creation_win_susp_copy_latera.author: sigma

sigma/proc_creation_win_susp_copy_system.description:
Detects a suspicious copy operation that tries to copy a program from a system (System32 or SysWOW64) directory to another on disk.

sigma/proc_creation_win_susp_copy_system.author: sigma

sigma/proc_creation_win_susp_crypto_mini.description: Detects command line parameters or strings often used by crypto miners
sigma/proc_creation_win_susp_crypto_mini.author: sigma

sigma/proc_creation_win_susp_data_exfilt.description: Detects the use of various CLI utilities exfiltrating data via web requests

sigma/proc_creation_win_susp_disable_rac.description: Detects commands that indicate a Raccine removal from an end system. Raccine is a free ransomware protection tool.

sigma/proc_creation_win_susp_download_of.description: Detects suspicious ways to download files from Microsoft domains that are used to store attachments in Emails or OneNote documents
sigma/proc_creation_win_susp_download_of.author: sigma

sigma/proc_creation_win_susp_dumpstack_l.description: Detects the use of the filename DumpStack.log to evade Microsoft Defender
sigma/proc_creation_win_susp_dumpstack_l.author: sigma

sigma/proc_creation_win_susp_elavated_ms.description: Detects Windows Installer service (msiexec.exe) spawning "cmd" or "powershell"

sigma/proc_creation_win_susp_electron_ap.description:

sigma/proc_creation_win_susp_electron_ap.author: sigma

sigma/proc_creation_win_susp_elevated_sy.description: Detects when a shell program such as the Windows command prompt or PowerShell is launched with system privileges.
sigma/proc_creation_win_susp_elevated_sy.author: sigma

sigma/proc_creation_win_susp_embed_exe_l.description: Detects events that appear when a user click on a link file with a powershell command in it
sigma/proc_creation_win_susp_embed_exe_l.author: sigma

sigma/proc_creation_win_susp_execution_f.author: sigma

sigma/proc_creation_win_susp_execution_p.description: Detects a suspicious execution from an uncommon folder
sigma/proc_creation_win_susp_execution_p.author: sigma

sigma/proc_creation_win_susp_execution_p.author: sigma

sigma/proc_creation_win_susp_local_syste.author: sigma

sigma/proc_creation_win_susp_non_exe_ima.description: Checks whether the image specified in a process creation event doesn't refer to an .exe file (caused by process ghosting or other unorthodox methods to start a process)

sigma/proc_creation_win_susp_ntds.description: Detects suspicious process patterns used in NTDS.DIT exfiltration
sigma/proc_creation_win_susp_ntds.author: sigma

sigma/proc_creation_win_susp_ntfs_short_.author: sigma

sigma/proc_creation_win_susp_ntfs_short_.author: sigma

sigma/proc_creation_win_susp_obfuscated_.description: Detects use of an encoded/obfuscated version of an IP address (hex, octal...) in an URL combined with a download command

sigma/proc_creation_win_susp_obfuscated_.description: Detects usage of an encoded/obfuscated version of an IP address (hex, octal...) via commandline
sigma/proc_creation_win_susp_obfuscated_.author: sigma

sigma/proc_creation_win_susp_parents.description: Detects suspicious parent processes that should not have any children or should only have a single possible child program
sigma/proc_creation_win_susp_parents.author: sigma

sigma/proc_creation_win_susp_proc_wrong_.author: sigma

sigma/proc_creation_win_susp_progname.author: sigma

sigma/proc_creation_win_susp_redirect_lo.author: sigma

sigma/proc_creation_win_susp_remote_desk.description: Detects potential use of an SSH utility to establish RDP over a reverse SSH Tunnel. This can be used by attackers to enable routing of network packets that would otherwise not reach their intended destination.

sigma/proc_creation_win_susp_right_to_le.description:

sigma/proc_creation_win_susp_script_exec.description: Detects a suspicious script executions from temporary folder
sigma/proc_creation_win_susp_script_exec.author: sigma

sigma/proc_creation_win_susp_service_cre.description: Detects creation of a new service via "sc" command or the powershell "new-service" cmdlet with suspicious binary paths
sigma/proc_creation_win_susp_service_cre.author: sigma

sigma/proc_creation_win_susp_service_dir.author: sigma

sigma/proc_creation_win_susp_shadow_copi.author: sigma

sigma/proc_creation_win_susp_shadow_copi.description: Shadow Copies deletion using operating systems utilities
sigma/proc_creation_win_susp_shadow_copi.author: sigma

sigma/proc_creation_win_susp_shell_spawn.description: Detects suspicious child processes of a Windows shell and scripting processes such as wscript, rundll32, powershell, mshta...etc.
sigma/proc_creation_win_susp_shell_spawn.author: sigma

sigma/proc_creation_win_susp_sysnative.description: Detects process creation events that use the Sysnative folder (common for CobaltStrike spawns)
sigma/proc_creation_win_susp_sysnative.author: sigma

sigma/proc_creation_win_susp_system_exe_.description: Detects a Windows program executable started from a suspicious folder
sigma/proc_creation_win_susp_system_exe_.author: sigma

sigma/proc_creation_win_susp_system_user.description: Detects a suspicious process creation as SYSTEM user (suspicious program or command line parameter)
sigma/proc_creation_win_susp_system_user.author: sigma

sigma/proc_creation_win_susp_sysvol_acce.description: Detects Access to Domain Group Policies stored in SYSVOL
sigma/proc_creation_win_susp_sysvol_acce.author: sigma

sigma/proc_creation_win_susp_task_folder.description:
The Tasks folder in system32 and syswow64 are globally writable paths.
Adversaries can take advantage of this and load or influence any script hosts or ANY .NET Application 
in Tasks to load and execute a custom assembly into cscript, wscript, regsvr32, mshta, eventvwr
sigma/proc_creation_win_susp_task_folder.author: sigma

sigma/proc_creation_win_susp_use_of_te_b.description:
Windows Test Authoring and Execution Framework (TAEF) framework allows you to run automation by executing tests files written on different languages (C, C#, Microsoft COM Scripting interfaces
Adversaries may execute malicious code (such as WSC file with VBScript, dll and so on) directly by running te.exe
sigma/proc_creation_win_susp_use_of_te_b.author: sigma

labels.label: Malicious Windows Script Components File Execution by TAEF Detection

sigma/proc_creation_win_susp_use_of_vsji.description:
There is an option for a MS VS Just-In-Time Debugger "vsjitdebugger.exe" to launch specified executable and attach a debugger.
This option may be used adversaries to execute malicious code by signed verified binary.
The debugger is installed alongside with Microsoft Visual Studio package.
sigma/proc_creation_win_susp_use_of_vsji.author: sigma

labels.label: Malicious PE Execution by Microsoft Visual Studio Debugger

sigma/proc_creation_win_susp_userinit_ch.description: Detects a suspicious child process of userinit
sigma/proc_creation_win_susp_userinit_ch.author: sigma

sigma/proc_creation_win_susp_weak_or_abu.description: Detects weak passwords or often abused passwords (seen used by threat actors) via the CLI. An example would be a threat actor creating a new user via the net command and providing the password inline
sigma/proc_creation_win_susp_weak_or_abu.author: sigma

sigma/proc_creation_win_susp_web_request.description: Detects the use of various web request commands with commandline tools and Windows PowerShell cmdlets (including aliases) via CommandLine
sigma/proc_creation_win_susp_web_request.author: sigma

sigma/proc_creation_win_susp_whoami_as_p.description: Detects a suspicious process command line that uses whoami as first parameter (as e.g. used by EfsPotato)
sigma/proc_creation_win_susp_whoami_as_p.author: sigma

sigma/proc_creation_win_susp_workfolders.description: Detects using WorkFolders.exe to execute an arbitrary control.exe
sigma/proc_creation_win_susp_workfolders.author: sigma

sigma/proc_creation_win_svchost_executio.description: It is extremely abnormal for svchost.exe to spawn without any CLI arguments and is normally observed when a malicious process spawns the process and injects code into the process memory space.
sigma/proc_creation_win_svchost_executio.author: sigma

sigma/proc_creation_win_svchost_susp_par.description: Detects a suspicious svchost process start
sigma/proc_creation_win_svchost_susp_par.author: sigma

sigma/proc_creation_win_svchost_termserv.description: Detects a process spawned by the terminal service server process (this could be an indicator for an exploitation of CVE-2019-0708)
sigma/proc_creation_win_svchost_termserv.author: sigma

sigma/proc_creation_win_sysinternals_acc.description: Detects the usage of the "Accesschk" utility, an access and privilege audit tool developed by SysInternal and often being abused by attacker to verify process privileges
sigma/proc_creation_win_sysinternals_acc.author: sigma

sigma/proc_creation_win_sysinternals_ade.description: Detects the execution of Sysinternals ADExplorer with the "-snapshot" flag in order to save a local copy of the active directory database.
sigma/proc_creation_win_sysinternals_ade.author: sigma

sigma/proc_creation_win_sysinternals_ade.description: Detects the execution of Sysinternals ADExplorer with the "-snapshot" flag in order to save a local copy of the active directory database to a suspicious directory.
sigma/proc_creation_win_sysinternals_ade.author: sigma

labels.label: Suspicious Active Directory Database Snapshot Via ADExplorer

sigma/proc_creation_win_sysinternals_eul.description: Detects command lines that contain the 'accepteula' flag which could be a sign of execution of one of the Sysinternals tools
sigma/proc_creation_win_sysinternals_eul.author: sigma

sigma/proc_creation_win_sysinternals_liv.description: Detects execution of LiveKD based on PE metadata or image name
sigma/proc_creation_win_sysinternals_liv.author: sigma

sigma/proc_creation_win_sysinternals_liv.description: Detects execution of LiveKD with the "-m" flag to potentially dump the kernel memory
sigma/proc_creation_win_sysinternals_liv.author: sigma

sigma/proc_creation_win_sysinternals_pro.description: Detects usage of the SysInternals Procdump utility
sigma/proc_creation_win_sysinternals_pro.author: sigma

sigma/proc_creation_win_sysinternals_pro.description: Detects uses of the SysInternals ProcDump utility in which ProcDump or its output get renamed, or a dump file is moved or copied to a different name
sigma/proc_creation_win_sysinternals_pro.author: sigma

sigma/proc_creation_win_sysinternals_pro.description:
Detects suspicious uses of the SysInternals Procdump utility by using a special command line parameter in combination with the lsass.exe process.
This way we are also able to catch cases in which the attacker has renamed the procdump executable.
sigma/proc_creation_win_sysinternals_pro.author: sigma

labels.label: Potential LSASS Process Dump Via Procdump

sigma/proc_creation_win_sysinternals_pse.description: Detects user accept agreement execution in psexec commandline
sigma/proc_creation_win_sysinternals_pse.author: sigma

sigma/proc_creation_win_sysinternals_pse.description: Detects suspicious commandline flags used by PsExec and PAExec to escalate a command line to LOCAL_SYSTEM rights
sigma/proc_creation_win_sysinternals_pse.author: sigma

sigma/proc_creation_win_sysinternals_pse.description: Detects potential psexec command that initiate execution on a remote systems via common commandline flags used by the utility
sigma/proc_creation_win_sysinternals_pse.author: sigma

sigma/proc_creation_win_sysinternals_pse.description: Detects launch of the PSEXESVC service, which means that this system was the target of a psexec remote execution

sigma/proc_creation_win_sysinternals_pse.description: Detects suspicious launch of the PSEXESVC service on this system and a sub process run as LOCAL_SYSTEM (-s), which means that someone remotely started a command on this system running it with highest privileges and not only the privileges of the login user account (e.g. the administrator account)

sigma/proc_creation_win_sysinternals_psl.description: Detects usage of the PsLogList utility to dump event log in order to extract admin accounts and perform account discovery or delete events logs
sigma/proc_creation_win_sysinternals_psl.author: sigma

sigma/proc_creation_win_sysinternals_pss.description: Detects usage of Sysinternals PsService which can be abused for service reconnaissance and tampering
sigma/proc_creation_win_sysinternals_pss.author: sigma

sigma/proc_creation_win_sysinternals_pss.description: Detects usage of Sysinternals PsSuspend which can be abused to suspend critical processes
sigma/proc_creation_win_sysinternals_pss.author: sigma

sigma/proc_creation_win_sysinternals_pss.description: Detects suspicious execution of Sysinternals PsSuspend, where the utility is used to suspend critical processes such as AV or EDR to bypass defenses
sigma/proc_creation_win_sysinternals_pss.author: sigma

sigma/proc_creation_win_sysinternals_sde.description: Detects the use of SDelete to erase a file not the free space
sigma/proc_creation_win_sysinternals_sde.author: sigma

sigma/proc_creation_win_sysinternals_sus.description: Detects unknown program using commandline flags usually used by tools such as PsExec and PAExec to start programs with SYSTEM Privileges
sigma/proc_creation_win_sysinternals_sus.author: sigma

sigma/proc_creation_win_sysinternals_too.description: Detects binaries that use the same name as legitimate sysinternals tools to evade detection

sigma/proc_creation_win_sysprep_appdata.description: Detects suspicious sysprep process start with AppData folder as target (as used by Trojan Syndicasec in Thrip report by Symantec)

sigma/proc_creation_win_systeminfo_execu.description: Detects usage of the "systeminfo" command to retrieve information

sigma/proc_creation_win_systemsettingsad.description: Detects when a user enable developer features such as "Developer Mode" or "Application Sideloading". Which allows the user to install untrusted packages.
