sigma/proc_creation_win_tapinstall_execu.description: Well-known TAP software installation. Possible preparation for data exfiltration using tunneling techniques
sigma/proc_creation_win_tapinstall_execu.author: sigma

sigma/proc_creation_win_taskkill_executi.description: Adversaries may stop services or processes in order to conduct Data Destruction or Data Encrypted for Impact on the data stores of services like Exchange and SQL Server.
sigma/proc_creation_win_taskkill_executi.author: sigma

sigma/proc_creation_win_taskkill_sep.description:
Detects one of the possible scenarios for disabling Symantec Endpoint Protection.
Symantec Endpoint Protection antivirus software services incorrectly implement the protected service mechanism.
As a result, the NT AUTHORITY/SYSTEM user can execute the taskkill /im command several times ccSvcHst.exe /f, thereby killing the process belonging to the service, and thus shutting down the service.
sigma/proc_creation_win_taskkill_sep.author: sigma

sigma/proc_creation_win_tasklist_basic_e.description: Adversaries may attempt to get information about running processes on a system. Information obtained could be used to gain an understanding of common software/applications running on systems within the network
sigma/proc_creation_win_tasklist_basic_e.author: sigma

sigma/proc_creation_win_taskmgr_localsys.description: Detects the creation of taskmgr.exe process in context of LOCAL_SYSTEM
sigma/proc_creation_win_taskmgr_localsys.author: sigma

sigma/proc_creation_win_taskmgr_susp_chi.description: Detects the creation of a process from Windows task manager
sigma/proc_creation_win_taskmgr_susp_chi.author: sigma

sigma/proc_creation_win_teams_suspicious.description: Detects an access to authentication tokens and accounts of Microsoft Teams desktop application.
sigma/proc_creation_win_teams_suspicious.author: sigma

labels.label: Suspicious Command With Teams Objects Paths

sigma/proc_creation_win_tpmvscmgr_add_vi.description: Detects execution of "Tpmvscmgr.exe" to create a new virtual smart card.
sigma/proc_creation_win_tpmvscmgr_add_vi.author: sigma

labels.label: New Virtual Smart Card Created Via TpmVscMgr.EXE

sigma/proc_creation_win_tscon_localsyste.description: Detects a tscon.exe start as LOCAL SYSTEM
sigma/proc_creation_win_tscon_localsyste.author: sigma

sigma/proc_creation_win_tscon_rdp_redire.description: Detects a suspicious RDP session redirect using tscon.exe
sigma/proc_creation_win_tscon_rdp_redire.author: sigma

sigma/proc_creation_win_tscon_rdp_sessio.description: Detects potential RDP Session Hijacking activity on Windows systems
sigma/proc_creation_win_tscon_rdp_sessio.author: sigma

sigma/proc_creation_win_uac_bypass_chang.description: Detects an UAC bypass that uses changepk.exe and slui.exe (UACMe 61)
sigma/proc_creation_win_uac_bypass_chang.author: sigma

labels.label: UAC Bypass Using ChangePK and SLUI

sigma/proc_creation_win_uac_bypass_clean.description: Detects the pattern of UAC Bypass using scheduled tasks and variable expansion of cleanmgr.exe (UACMe 34)
sigma/proc_creation_win_uac_bypass_clean.author: sigma

sigma/proc_creation_win_uac_bypass_cmstp.description: Detect commandline usage of Microsoft Connection Manager Profile Installer (cmstp.exe) to install specially formatted local .INF files
sigma/proc_creation_win_uac_bypass_cmstp.author: sigma

sigma/proc_creation_win_uac_bypass_cmstp.description: Detects UAC Bypass Attempt Using Microsoft Connection Manager Profile Installer Autoelevate-capable COM Objects (e.g. UACMe ID of 41, 43, 58 or 65)
sigma/proc_creation_win_uac_bypass_cmstp.author: sigma

labels.label: CMSTP UAC Bypass via COM Object Access

sigma/proc_creation_win_uac_bypass_compu.description: Detects tools such as UACMe used to bypass UAC with computerdefaults.exe (UACMe 59)
sigma/proc_creation_win_uac_bypass_compu.author: sigma

sigma/proc_creation_win_uac_bypass_conse.description: Detects the pattern of UAC Bypass using consent.exe and comctl32.dll (UACMe 22)
sigma/proc_creation_win_uac_bypass_conse.author: sigma

labels.label: UAC Bypass Using Consent and Comctl32 - Process

sigma/proc_creation_win_uac_bypass_dismh.description: Detects the pattern of UAC Bypass using DismHost DLL hijacking (UACMe 63)
sigma/proc_creation_win_uac_bypass_dismh.author: sigma

sigma/proc_creation_win_uac_bypass_event.description: Detects UAC bypass method using Windows event viewer
sigma/proc_creation_win_uac_bypass_event.author: sigma

sigma/proc_creation_win_uac_bypass_event.description: Detects the pattern of UAC Bypass using Event Viewer RecentViews
sigma/proc_creation_win_uac_bypass_event.author: sigma

labels.label: UAC Bypass Using Event Viewer RecentViews

sigma/proc_creation_win_uac_bypass_fodhe.description: Identifies use of Fodhelper.exe to bypass User Account Control. Adversaries use this technique to execute privileged processes.
sigma/proc_creation_win_uac_bypass_fodhe.author: sigma

sigma/proc_creation_win_uac_bypass_hijac.description: Detects attempts to bypass User Account Control (UAC) by hijacking the Microsoft Management Console (MMC) Windows Firewall snap-in
sigma/proc_creation_win_uac_bypass_hijac.author: sigma

labels.label: UAC Bypass via Windows Firewall Snap-In Hijack

sigma/proc_creation_win_uac_bypass_icmlu.description: Detects the pattern of UAC Bypass using ICMLuaUtil Elevated COM interface
sigma/proc_creation_win_uac_bypass_icmlu.author: sigma

sigma/proc_creation_win_uac_bypass_ieins.description: Detects the pattern of UAC Bypass using IEInstal.exe (UACMe 64)
sigma/proc_creation_win_uac_bypass_ieins.author: sigma

sigma/proc_creation_win_uac_bypass_mscon.description: Detects the pattern of UAC Bypass using a msconfig GUI hack (UACMe 55)
sigma/proc_creation_win_uac_bypass_mscon.author: sigma

labels.label: UAC Bypass Using MSConfig Token Modification - Process

sigma/proc_creation_win_uac_bypass_ntfs_.description: Detects the pattern of UAC Bypass using NTFS reparse point and wusa.exe DLL hijacking (UACMe 36)
sigma/proc_creation_win_uac_bypass_ntfs_.author: sigma

labels.label: UAC Bypass Using NTFS Reparse Point - Process

sigma/proc_creation_win_uac_bypass_pkgmg.description: Detects the pattern of UAC Bypass using pkgmgr.exe and dism.exe (UACMe 23)
sigma/proc_creation_win_uac_bypass_pkgmg.author: sigma

labels.label: UAC Bypass Using PkgMgr and DISM

sigma/proc_creation_win_uac_bypass_sdclt.description: A General detection for sdclt being spawned as an elevated process. This could be an indicator of sdclt being used for bypass UAC techniques.
sigma/proc_creation_win_uac_bypass_sdclt.author: sigma

sigma/proc_creation_win_uac_bypass_trust.description: Detects indicators of a UAC bypass method by mocking directories
sigma/proc_creation_win_uac_bypass_trust.author: sigma

sigma/proc_creation_win_uac_bypass_winsa.description: Detects the pattern of UAC Bypass using a path parsing issue in winsat.exe (UACMe 52)
sigma/proc_creation_win_uac_bypass_winsa.author: sigma

labels.label: UAC Bypass Abusing Winsat Path Parsing - Process

sigma/proc_creation_win_uac_bypass_wmp.description: Detects the pattern of UAC Bypass using Windows Media Player osksupport.dll (UACMe 32)
sigma/proc_creation_win_uac_bypass_wmp.author: sigma

labels.label: UAC Bypass Using Windows Media Player - Process

sigma/proc_creation_win_uac_bypass_wsres.description: Detects use of WSReset.exe to bypass User Account Control (UAC). Adversaries use this technique to execute privileged processes.
sigma/proc_creation_win_uac_bypass_wsres.author: sigma

sigma/proc_creation_win_uac_bypass_wsres.description: Detects the pattern of UAC Bypass via WSReset usable by default sysmon-config
sigma/proc_creation_win_uac_bypass_wsres.author: sigma

sigma/proc_creation_win_ultravnc.description: An adversary may use legitimate desktop support and remote access software,to establish an interactive command and control channel to target systems within networks
sigma/proc_creation_win_ultravnc.author: sigma

labels.label: Use of UltraVNC Remote Access Software

sigma/proc_creation_win_ultravnc_susp_ex.description: Detects suspicious UltraVNC command line flag combination that indicate a auto reconnect upon execution, e.g. startup (as seen being used by Gamaredon threat group)
sigma/proc_creation_win_ultravnc_susp_ex.author: sigma

sigma/proc_creation_win_uninstall_crowds.description: Adversaries may disable security tools to avoid possible detection of their tools and activities by uninstalling Crowdstrike Falcon
sigma/proc_creation_win_uninstall_crowds.author: sigma

sigma/proc_creation_win_userinit_uncommo.description: Detects uncommon "userinit.exe" child processes, which could be a sign of uncommon shells or login scripts used for persistence.
sigma/proc_creation_win_userinit_uncommo.author: sigma

sigma/proc_creation_win_vaultcmd_list_cr.description: List credentials currently stored in Windows Credential Manager via the native Windows utility vaultcmd.exe
sigma/proc_creation_win_vaultcmd_list_cr.author: sigma

labels.label: Windows Credential Manager Access via VaultCmd

sigma/proc_creation_win_verclsid_runs_co.description: Detects when verclsid.exe is used to run COM object via GUID
sigma/proc_creation_win_verclsid_runs_co.author: sigma

sigma/proc_creation_win_virtualbox_execu.description: Adversaries can carry out malicious operations using a virtual instance to avoid detection. This rule is built to detect the registration of the Virtualbox driver or start of a Virtualbox VM.
sigma/proc_creation_win_virtualbox_execu.author: sigma

labels.label: Detect Virtualbox Driver Installation OR Starting Of VMs

sigma/proc_creation_win_virtualbox_vboxd.description:
Detect VBoxDrvInst.exe run with parameters allowing processing INF file.
This allows to create values in the registry and install drivers.
For example one could use this technique to obtain persistence via modifying one of Run or RunOnce registry keys
sigma/proc_creation_win_virtualbox_vboxd.author: sigma

sigma/proc_creation_win_vmware_vmtoolsd_.description: Detects suspicious child process creations of VMware Tools process which may indicate persistence setup
sigma/proc_creation_win_vmware_vmtoolsd_.author: sigma

sigma/proc_creation_win_vscode_child_pro.description: Detects uncommon or suspicious child processes spawning from a VsCode "code.exe" process. This could indicate an attempt of persistence via VsCode tasks or terminal profiles.
sigma/proc_creation_win_vscode_child_pro.author: sigma

sigma/proc_creation_win_vslsagent_agente.description: Detects Microsoft Visual Studio vsls-agent.exe lolbin execution with a suspicious library load using the --agentExtensionPath parameter
sigma/proc_creation_win_vslsagent_agente.author: sigma

labels.label: Suspicious Vsls-Agent Command With AgentExtensionPath Load

sigma/proc_creation_win_w32tm.description: When configured with suitable command line arguments, w32tm can act as a delay mechanism
sigma/proc_creation_win_w32tm.author: sigma

sigma/proc_creation_win_wab_execution_fr.description: Detects execution of wab.exe (Windows Contacts) and Wabmig.exe (Microsoft Address Book Import Tool) from non default locations as seen with bumblebee activity
sigma/proc_creation_win_wab_execution_fr.author: sigma

labels.label: Wab Execution From Non Default Location

sigma/proc_creation_win_wab_unusual_pare.description: Detects unusual parent or children of the wab.exe (Windows Contacts) and Wabmig.exe (Microsoft Address Book Import Tool) processes as seen being used with bumblebee activity
sigma/proc_creation_win_wab_unusual_pare.author: sigma

labels.label: Wab/Wabmig Unusual Parent Or Child Processes

sigma/proc_creation_win_wbadmin_delete_s.description:
Deletes the Windows systemstatebackup using wbadmin.exe.
This technique is used by numerous ransomware families.
This may only be successful on server platforms that have Windows Backup enabled.
sigma/proc_creation_win_wbadmin_delete_s.author: sigma

sigma/proc_creation_win_webshell_chopper.description: Detects patterns found in process executions cause by China Chopper like tiny (ASPX) webshells
sigma/proc_creation_win_webshell_chopper.author: sigma

sigma/proc_creation_win_webshell_detecti.description: Detects certain command line parameters often used during reconnaissance activity via web shells
sigma/proc_creation_win_webshell_detecti.author: sigma

labels.label: Webshell Detection With Command Line Keywords

sigma/proc_creation_win_webshell_hacking.description: Detects certain parent child patterns found in cases in which a webshell is used to perform certain credential dumping or exfiltration activities on a compromised system
sigma/proc_creation_win_webshell_hacking.author: sigma

sigma/proc_creation_win_webshell_recon_d.description: Detects processes spawned from web servers (php, tomcat, iis...etc) that perform reconnaissance looking for the existence of popular scripting tools (perl, python, wget) on the system via the help commands
sigma/proc_creation_win_webshell_recon_d.author: sigma

labels.label: Webshell Recon Detection Via CommandLine & Processes

sigma/proc_creation_win_webshell_spawn.description: Detects web servers that spawn shell processes which could be the result of a successfully placed web shell or another attack
sigma/proc_creation_win_webshell_spawn.author: sigma

sigma/proc_creation_win_werfault_lsass_s.description: Detects potential credential dumping via Windows Error Reporting LSASS Shtinkering technique which uses the Windows Error Reporting to dump lsass
sigma/proc_creation_win_werfault_lsass_s.author: sigma

sigma/proc_creation_win_wermgr_susp_chil.description: Detects suspicious Windows Error Reporting manager (wermgr.exe) process patterns - suspicious parents / children, execution folders, command lines etc.
sigma/proc_creation_win_wermgr_susp_chil.author: sigma

sigma/proc_creation_win_wevtutil_recon.description: Detects usage of the wevtutil utility to perform reconnaissance
sigma/proc_creation_win_wevtutil_recon.author: sigma

sigma/proc_creation_win_where_browser_da.description:
Adversaries may enumerate browser bookmarks to learn more about compromised hosts.
Browser bookmarks may reveal personal information about users (ex: banking sites, interests, social media, etc.) as well as details about
internal network resources such as servers, tools/dashboards, or other related infrastructure.
sigma/proc_creation_win_where_browser_da.author: sigma

sigma/proc_creation_win_whoami_execution.description: Detects the execution of whoami, which is often used by attackers after exploitation / privilege escalation
sigma/proc_creation_win_whoami_execution.author: sigma

sigma/proc_creation_win_whoami_execution.description: Detects the execution of "whoami.exe" by privileged accounts that are often abused by threat actors
sigma/proc_creation_win_whoami_execution.author: sigma

labels.label: Suspicious Whoami.EXE Execution From Privileged Process

sigma/proc_creation_win_whoami_groups_di.description: Detects the execution of whoami.exe with the /group command line flag to show group membership for the current user, account type, security identifiers (SID), and attributes.
sigma/proc_creation_win_whoami_groups_di.author: sigma

sigma/proc_creation_win_whoami_parent_an.description: Detects the execution of whoami.exe with suspicious parent processes.
sigma/proc_creation_win_whoami_parent_an.author: sigma

sigma/proc_creation_win_whoami_priv_disc.description: Detects a whoami.exe executed with the /priv command line flag instructing the tool to show all current user privileges. This is often used after a privilege escalation attempt.
sigma/proc_creation_win_whoami_priv_disc.author: sigma

sigma/proc_creation_win_whoami_susp_flag.description: Detects the execution of "whoami.exe" with the "/all" flag or with redirection options to export the results to a file for later use.
sigma/proc_creation_win_whoami_susp_flag.author: sigma

sigma/proc_creation_win_windows_terminal.description: Detects suspicious children spawned via the Windows Terminal application which could be a sign of persistence via WindowsTerminal (see references section)
sigma/proc_creation_win_windows_terminal.author: sigma

sigma/proc_creation_win_winget_add_custo.description: Detects usage of winget to add new additional download sources
sigma/proc_creation_win_winget_add_custo.author: sigma

labels.label: Add New Download Source To Winget

sigma/proc_creation_win_winget_add_insec.description:
Detects usage of winget to add a new insecure (http) download source.
Winget will not allow the addition of insecure sources, hence this could indicate potential suspicious activity (or typos)
sigma/proc_creation_win_winget_add_insec.author: sigma

labels.label: Add Insecure Download Source To Winget

sigma/proc_creation_win_winget_add_susp_.description: Detects usage of winget to add new potentially suspicious download sources
sigma/proc_creation_win_winget_add_susp_.author: sigma

labels.label: Add Potential Suspicious New Download Source To Winget

sigma/proc_creation_win_winget_local_ins.description:
Detects usage of winget to install applications via manifest file. Adversaries can abuse winget to download payloads remotely and execute them.
The manifest option enables you to install an application by passing in a YAML file directly to the client.
Winget can be used to download and install exe, msi or msix files later.
sigma/proc_creation_win_winget_local_ins.author: sigma

labels.label: Install New Package Via Winget Local Manifest

sigma/proc_creation_win_winrar_dmp.description: Detects a suspicious winrar execution that involves a file with a ".dmp"/".dump" extension, which could be a step in a process of dump file exfiltration
sigma/proc_creation_win_winrar_dmp.author: sigma

sigma/proc_creation_win_winrar_execution.description: Detects a suspicious winrar execution in a folder which is not the default installation folder
sigma/proc_creation_win_winrar_execution.author: sigma

sigma/proc_creation_win_winrm_awl_bypass.description: Detects execution of attacker-controlled WsmPty.xsl or WsmTxt.xsl via winrm.vbs and copied cscript.exe (can be renamed)
sigma/proc_creation_win_winrm_awl_bypass.author: sigma

labels.label: AWL Bypass with Winrm.vbs and Malicious WsmPty.xsl/WsmTxt.xsl

sigma/proc_creation_win_winrm_execution_.description: Detects an attempt to execute code or create service on remote host via winrm.vbs.
sigma/proc_creation_win_winrm_execution_.author: sigma

sigma/proc_creation_win_winrm_remote_pow.description: Detects remote PowerShell sections by monitoring for wsmprovhost (WinRM host process) as a parent or child process (sign of an active PowerShell remote session).
sigma/proc_creation_win_winrm_remote_pow.author: sigma

sigma/proc_creation_win_winrm_susp_child.description: Detects suspicious processes including shells spawnd from WinRM host process
sigma/proc_creation_win_winrm_susp_child.author: sigma

sigma/proc_creation_win_winzip_password_.description: An adversary may compress or encrypt data that is collected prior to exfiltration using 3rd party utilities
sigma/proc_creation_win_winzip_password_.author: sigma

labels.label: Compress Data and Lock With Password for Exfiltration With WINZIP

sigma/proc_creation_win_wmi_backdoor_exc.description: Detects a WMI backdoor in Exchange Transport Agents via WMI event filters
sigma/proc_creation_win_wmi_backdoor_exc.author: sigma

sigma/proc_creation_win_wmic_eventconsum.description: Detects WMIC executions in which an event consumer gets created. This could be used to establish persistence
sigma/proc_creation_win_wmic_eventconsum.author: sigma

sigma/proc_creation_win_wmic_namespace_d.description: Detects potential tampering with Windows Defender settings such as adding exclusion using wmic
sigma/proc_creation_win_wmic_namespace_d.author: sigma

labels.label: Potential Windows Defender Tampering Via Wmic.EXE

sigma/proc_creation_win_wmic_process_cre.description: Detects new process creation using WMIC via the "process call create" flag
sigma/proc_creation_win_wmic_process_cre.author: sigma

sigma/proc_creation_win_wmic_recon_compu.description: Detects execution of wmic utility with the "computersystem" flag in order to obtain information about the machine such as the domain, username, model, etc.
sigma/proc_creation_win_wmic_recon_compu.author: sigma

sigma/proc_creation_win_wmic_recon_cspro.description: Detects the execution of WMIC with the "csproduct" which is used to obtain information such as hardware models and vendor information
sigma/proc_creation_win_wmic_recon_cspro.author: sigma

sigma/proc_creation_win_wmic_recon_group.description:
Detects the execution of "wmic" with the "group" flag.
Adversaries may attempt to find local system groups and permission settings.
The knowledge of local system permission groups can help adversaries determine which groups exist and which users belong to a particular group.
Adversaries may use this information to determine which users have elevated permissions, such as the users found within the local administrators group.
sigma/proc_creation_win_wmic_recon_group.author: sigma

sigma/proc_creation_win_wmic_recon_hotfi.description: Detects the execution of wmic with the "qfe" flag in order to obtain information about installed hotfix updates on the system. This is often used by pentester and attacker enumeration scripts
sigma/proc_creation_win_wmic_recon_hotfi.author: sigma

labels.label: Windows Hotfix Updates Reconnaissance Via Wmic.EXE

sigma/proc_creation_win_wmic_recon_proce.description: Detects the execution of "wmic" with the "process" flag, which adversary might use to list processes running on the compromised host or list installed software hotfixes and patches.
sigma/proc_creation_win_wmic_recon_proce.author: sigma

sigma/proc_creation_win_wmic_recon_produ.description: Detects the execution of WMIC in order to get a list of firewall and antivirus products
sigma/proc_creation_win_wmic_recon_produ.author: sigma

sigma/proc_creation_win_wmic_recon_produ.description: Detects the execution of WMIC in order to get a list of firewall and antivirus products
sigma/proc_creation_win_wmic_recon_produ.author: sigma

labels.label: Potential Product Class Reconnaissance Via Wmic.EXE

sigma/proc_creation_win_wmic_recon_servi.description:
An adversary might use WMI to check if a certain remote service is running on a remote device.
When the test completes, a service information will be displayed on the screen if it exists.
A common feedback message is that "No instance(s) Available" if the service queried is not running.
A common error message is "Node - (provided IP or default) ERROR Description =The RPC server is unavailable" if the provided remote host is unreachable
sigma/proc_creation_win_wmic_recon_servi.author: sigma

sigma/proc_creation_win_wmic_recon_syste.description:
Detects the use of the WMI command-line (WMIC) utility to identify and display various system information,
including OS, CPU, GPU, and disk drive names; memory capacity; display resolution; and baseboard, BIOS,
and GPU driver products/versions.
Some of these commands were used by Aurora Stealer in late 2022/early 2023.
sigma/proc_creation_win_wmic_recon_syste.author: sigma

labels.label: Potential System Information Discovery Via Wmic.EXE

sigma/proc_creation_win_wmic_recon_unquo.description: Detects known WMI recon method to look for unquoted service paths using wmic. Often used by pentester and attacker enumeration scripts
sigma/proc_creation_win_wmic_recon_unquo.author: sigma

labels.label: Potential Unquoted Service Path Reconnaissance Via Wmic.EXE

sigma/proc_creation_win_wmic_remote_exec.description: Detects the execution of WMIC to query information on a remote system
sigma/proc_creation_win_wmic_remote_exec.author: sigma

sigma/proc_creation_win_wmic_service_man.description: Detects usage of wmic to start or stop a service
sigma/proc_creation_win_wmic_service_man.author: sigma

sigma/proc_creation_win_wmic_squiblytwo_.description: Detects potential SquiblyTwo attack technique with possible renamed WMIC via Imphash and OriginalFileName fields
sigma/proc_creation_win_wmic_squiblytwo_.author: sigma

sigma/proc_creation_win_wmic_susp_execut.description: Office application called wmic to proxye execution through a LOLBIN process. This is often used to break suspicious parent-child chain (Office app spawns LOLBin).
sigma/proc_creation_win_wmic_susp_execut.author: sigma

labels.label: Suspicious WMIC Execution Via Office Process

sigma/proc_creation_win_wmic_susp_proces.description: Detects WMIC executing "process call create" with suspicious calls to processes such as "rundll32", "regsrv32", etc.
sigma/proc_creation_win_wmic_susp_proces.author: sigma

sigma/proc_creation_win_wmic_uninstall_s.description: Detects uninstallation or termination of security products using the WMIC utility
sigma/proc_creation_win_wmic_uninstall_s.author: sigma

labels.label: Potential Tampering With Security Products Via WMIC

sigma/proc_creation_win_wmic_xsl_script_.description: Extensible Stylesheet Language (XSL) files are commonly used to describe the processing and rendering of data within XML files. Rule detects when adversaries abuse this functionality to execute arbitrary files while potentially bypassing application whitelisting defenses.
sigma/proc_creation_win_wmic_xsl_script_.author: sigma

sigma/proc_creation_win_wmiprvse_spawns_.description: Detects Powershell as a child of the WmiPrvSE process. Which could be a sign of lateral movement via WMI.
sigma/proc_creation_win_wmiprvse_spawns_.author: sigma

labels.label: Potential WMI Lateral Movement WmiPrvSE Spawned PowerShell

sigma/proc_creation_win_wmiprvse_susp_ch.description: Detects suspicious and uncommon child processes of WmiPrvSE
sigma/proc_creation_win_wmiprvse_susp_ch.author: sigma

sigma/proc_creation_win_wpbbin_potential.description: Detects execution of the binary "wpbbin" which is used as part of the UEFI based persistence method described in the reference section
sigma/proc_creation_win_wpbbin_potential.author: sigma

sigma/proc_creation_win_wscript_cscript_.description: Detects script file execution (.js, .jse, .vba, .vbe, .vbs, .wsf) by Wscript/Cscript
sigma/proc_creation_win_wscript_cscript_.author: sigma

sigma/proc_creation_win_wscript_cscript_.description: Detects suspicious child processes of Wscript/Cscript
sigma/proc_creation_win_wscript_cscript_.author: sigma

sigma/proc_creation_win_wscript_cscript_.description: Detects Wscript/Cscript executing a file with an uncommon (i.e. non-script) extension
sigma/proc_creation_win_wscript_cscript_.author: sigma

sigma/proc_creation_win_wsl_child_proces.description: Detects uncommon or suspicious child processes spawning from a WSL process. This could indicate an attempt to evade parent/child relationship detections or persistence attempts via cron using WSL
sigma/proc_creation_win_wsl_child_proces.author: sigma

sigma/proc_creation_win_wsl_lolbin_execu.description: Detects potential abuse of Windows Subsystem for Linux (WSL) binary as a LOLBIN to execute arbitrary Linux or Windows commands
sigma/proc_creation_win_wsl_lolbin_execu.author: sigma

sigma/proc_creation_win_wsl_windows_bina.description: Detects the execution of Windows binaries from within a WSL instance. This could be used to masquerade parent-child relationships
sigma/proc_creation_win_wsl_windows_bina.author: sigma

sigma/proc_creation_win_wuauclt_executio.description: Detects code execution via the Windows Update client (wuauclt)
sigma/proc_creation_win_wuauclt_executio.author: sigma

sigma/proc_creation_win_wuauclt_no_cli_f.description: Detects suspicious Windows Update Agent activity in which a wuauclt.exe process command line doesn't contain any command line flags
sigma/proc_creation_win_wuauclt_no_cli_f.author: sigma

labels.label: Suspicious Windows Update Agent Empty Cmdline

sigma/proc_creation_win_wusa_cab_files_e.description: Detects usage of the "wusa.exe" (Windows Update Standalone Installer) utility to extract cab using the "/extract" argument which is not longer supported. This could indicate an attacker using an old technique
sigma/proc_creation_win_wusa_cab_files_e.author: sigma

sigma/proc_creation_win_wusa_cab_files_e.description: Detects usage of the "wusa.exe" (Windows Update Standalone Installer) utility to extract cab using the "/extract" argument from suspicious paths
sigma/proc_creation_win_wusa_cab_files_e.author: sigma

labels.label: Wusa Extracting Cab Files From Suspicious Paths
